page.title: 20CUSTOMS IN BEDWORTH. CREDITS
page.content: A custom unique to Bedworth takes place annually in late May.-that of { {FOUNDERS DAY}or{BUN DAY},as it is more popularly known.This is to commemorate an important figure in the town's history-Nicholas Chamberlaine,Rector of Bedworth from 1663 to 1715.His endowment still helps to maintain 5 Church schools & some Almshouses in the town today.On Bun Day,children on roll from all 5 schools receive a bun as a token gift from the Trust.This is presented to them outside the Almshouses,by local dignitaries & Trustees. {CREDITS}must go to the pupils & staff of{CEDARS FIRST SCHOOL,ST.GILES C. {MIDDLE SCHOOL}&{NEWDIGATE MIDDLE {SCHOOL}for their help in preparing the information on the tapes.Also to{MARK {LISSAMAN}for time spent typing in the text.
